intro: Arrabidaea coleocalyx var. induta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant is typically evergreen and thrives in humid, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the year.
